name: sough
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
(especially of the wind or sea) to make a long high or low sound while moving: The wind soughed through the towering pines nearby. We walked across the moor with the sea soughing below.
More examplesFewer examplesThe sea soughed on the shore. She heard nothing but the cold wind that soughed in the trees.A bird slid past, wings soughing as it flew down towards the water below.

the high or low long sound that something such as the wind or sea makes as it moves: the sough of wind through the pine trees You can almost hear the sough of the sea far off.
More examplesFewer examplesthe sough of the low wind murmuring through the treesThe sough of the wind in the aspen leaves can always be heard. That evening calm betrayed the tinkle of the nearest streams and the sough of the most remote.
